predictions.text: By 2025-11-05, Congress will pass and the President will sign a continuing resolution funding the federal government, ending the current shutdown.
predictions.verification_criteria: Congress.gov shows an enacted continuing resolution (Public Law) providing appropriations, and WhiteHouse.gov posts the signing by or on 2025-11-05.
monitoring_signals: House and Senate floor calendars and whip counts
Congress.gov bill text and status for a CR
Statements from leadership (Speaker, Senate Majority Leader)
predictions.rationale: Political pressure and market incentives favor a short-term CR to end the shutdown.

predictions.text: ISM Services PMI (headline, SA) for October 2025 will print between 50.0 and 52.0 in ISM’s release due by 2025-11-05.
predictions.verification_criteria: The Institute for Supply Management Report On Business for October 2025 shows Services PMI within 50.0–52.0 on ismworld.org.
monitoring_signals: S&P Global U.S. Services PMI final
Regional Fed services surveys (Empire, Philly, Dallas)
High-frequency card spending and mobility data
ISM New Orders and Employment subindices
NFIB Small Business optimism and hiring plans
predictions.rationale: Services remain modestly expansionary as goods cool; softer rates support activity.

predictions.text: U.S. Nonfarm Payrolls (total, CES) for October 2025 will increase by between 130,000 and 210,000 jobs in the BLS Employment Situation report due 2025-11-07.
predictions.verification_criteria: BLS news release shows seasonally adjusted change in Total Nonfarm Payroll Employment (CES0000000001) for Oct 2025 within +130k to +210k.
predictions.rationale: Hiring cools but stays positive amid softer growth and ongoing restructuring.

predictions.text: U.S. PCE Price Index excluding food and energy (core, YoY, SA) for September 2025 will print between 2.7% and 2.9% in the BEA release due by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: BEA release (Table 11.1 or equivalent) shows the 12-month percent change of core PCE for Sep 2025 in the 2.7%–2.9% range.
monitoring_signals: Shelter and used car price indicators
Health insurance and residual seasonality adjustments
predictions.rationale: Disinflation persists as goods prices ease and shelter momentum gradually fades.

predictions.text: Euro area HICP excluding energy and food (core, YoY) for October 2025 (flash) will print between 2.5% and 2.8%, per Eurostat.
predictions.verification_criteria: Eurostat flash inflation news release for Oct 2025 shows core HICP (ex energy and food) within 2.5%–2.8%.
monitoring_signals: Country flash CPI prints (Germany, France, Spain, Italy)
Energy base effects and gas/electricity tariffs
Negotiated wage growth and unit labor costs
predictions.rationale: Core inflation slows but remains above target, driven by services.

predictions.text: China Caixin Manufacturing PMI for October 2025 will print between 50.3 and 51.2.
predictions.verification_criteria: S&P Global/Caixin press release shows the Oct 2025 Caixin Manufacturing PMI headline in 50.3–51.2.
monitoring_signals: NBS Manufacturing PMI and export orders
South Korea/Taiwan exports as China-demand proxies
predictions.rationale: External demand stabilizes; private-sector PMI remains modestly expansionary.

predictions.text: ICE U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) will close at or below 104.50 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: DXY official closing value from ICE (or an equivalent widely cited close) is ≤ 104.50 on any date through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: U.S. data surprises (Citi Economic Surprise Index)
predictions.rationale: Softer U.S. data and easing Fed expectations can weigh on the dollar.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, BIS will publish in the Federal Register a temporary general license, enforcement pause, or deadline extension that delays implementation of at least one China-related AI/semiconductor export control introduced in 2024–2025.
predictions.verification_criteria: A Federal Register notice by BIS/Commerce dated on or before 2025-11-30 explicitly delays compliance/enforcement dates for a specified China-related AI/semiconductor control.
monitoring_signals: FederalRegister.gov advance notices and BIS press releases
Industry association letters (SIA) and public comments
White House/NSC statements on China tech policy
predictions.rationale: Signals of U.S.–China thaw and industry feedback point to near-term delays.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, Qualcomm will announce at least one publicly named partnership with a U.S. hyperscaler (Amazon, Microsoft, Google, or Meta) for its AI200/AI250 accelerators in an official Qualcomm press release or SEC filing.
predictions.verification_criteria: Qualcomm investor relations press release or SEC 8-K by 2025-11-30 that explicitly names Amazon, Microsoft, Google, or Meta as a partner/customer for AI200/AI250.
monitoring_signals: Hyperscaler blog posts and procurement signals
predictions.rationale: Post-launch momentum increases incentives to publicize an anchor hyperscaler win.

predictions.text: U.S. initial jobless claims (seasonally adjusted, headline) will print at or above 245,000 in at least one weekly Department of Labor report by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Any DOL Unemployment Insurance Weekly Claims News Release through 2025-11-30 reports seasonally adjusted initial claims ≥ 245,000 for the latest week.
monitoring_signals: WARN notices and Challenger job cuts data
State-level advance claims (e.g., CA, NY, TX)
predictions.rationale: Restructuring in tech/retail and slower growth raise risk of an uptick.

predictions.text: Meta Platforms Q3 2025 total revenue year-over-year growth will be between 16% and 22%, per the company’s earnings release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Meta’s Q3 2025 earnings release or 8-K shows total revenue growth (YoY) within 16%–22%.
monitoring_signals: Digital ad spend trackers and agency checks
Vertical ad demand (retail, gaming, AI startups)
predictions.rationale: Ad demand remains robust; product improvements and AI-driven targeting support growth.
